perturbation.original_text: WebMD MAKES NO REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, WITH RESPECT TO THE CONTENT OR THE ACCURACY OF THE CONTENT. WEBMD EXPRESSLY DISCLAIMS ALL WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND ALL WARRANTIES ARISING FROM CONDUCT, COURSE OF DEALING OR CUSTOM OF TRADE. IN NO EVENT WILL WEBMD OR ITS SUPPLIERS OR LICENSORS BE LIABLE UNDER ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, HOWEVER ARISING, FOR ANY COSTS OF COVER OR FOR INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES OF ANY KIND ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT, OR THE PROVISION OR USE OF CONTENT, EVEN IF WEBMD HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. WEBMD'S AGGREGATE LIABILITY FOR ALL DAMAGES, LOSSES AND CAUSES OF ACTION IN ANY WAY RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT OR THE CONTENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) OR OTHERWISE, EITHER JOINTLY OR SEVERALLY, SHALL NOT EXCEED FIFTY DOLLARS ($50). THIS SECTION REFLECTS AN ALLOCATION OF RISK BETWEEN THE PARTIES, IS NOT A PENALTY, AND SHALL BE EXCLUSIVE. THIS SECTION SHALL APPLY DESPITE ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY LIMITED WARRANTY OR REMEDY.
perturbation.changed_text: WebMD MAKES NO REPRESENTATIONS OR WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, WITH RESPECT TO THE CONTENT OR THE ACCURACY OF THE CONTENT. WebMD's aggregate liability for all damages, losses and causes of action in any way related to this agreement or the content, whether in contract, tort (including negligence) or otherwise, either jointly or severally, shall not exceed fifty dollars ($50), unless otherwise stated.
perturbation.explanation: This alteration removes explicit disclaimers of warranties (merchantability, fitness for purpose) and limits on liability, placing the aggregate liability statement within a clause that now contains an exception which undermines the disclaimer. This could be viewed as an unconscionable limitation of liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Varies by jurisdiction, potentially Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) provisions on warranty disclaimers and unconscionability.

perturbation.original_text: (b) Governing Law, Venue and Jurisdiction. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, without application of conflict of laws principles.
perturbation.changed_text: (b) Governing Law, Venue and Jurisdiction. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, with application of conflict of laws principles.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies New York law governs without regard to conflict of laws principles. Removing this ensures a conflict of laws analysis will be made to choose which jurisdiction applies. This change introduces uncertainty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: The original text is not violating any law, but the change creates a conflict.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may not be altered or modified except in writing signed by both parties hereto.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may not be altered or modified except with the verbal consent of both parties.
perturbation.explanation: Altering the contract to allow for verbal modification introduces a structural flaw. The Statute of Frauds, depending on jurisdiction and the nature of the agreement, may require certain contracts or modifications to be in writing to be enforceable. This change makes it easier to argue that modifications are valid even without written documentation, potentially leading to disputes over the terms.
